channel.title: Magor [Death]
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/P6QwVLy.png[/img]
[size=14pt][b]Information:[/b][/size]
[ul][li]Written from scratch[/li] [li]Netty 4.25 final - networking[/li] [li]Using gson library for all the data storage[/li][/ul]
Aiming on building a stable server with all the features in it ready for adding content, this goes from the basics like updating, movement, banking... up to skilling and dialogue systems etc..
[size=14pt][b]Todo:[/b][/size]
[ul][li]Basic Combat[/li] [li]Fix a clipping bug[/li][/ul]
[size=14pt][b]Media:[/b][/size] [size=8pt]Automated yelling npc's[/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/AZDDyAV.png[/img]
[size=8pt]Shopping[/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/40ZefRN.png[/img]
[size=8pt]Dialogues[/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/9ve6vIc.png[/img]
[size=8pt]Trading[/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/X1CoPTU.png[/img]
[size=8pt]Private messaging[/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/9tGFPyK.png[/img]
[size=8pt]Global ground items[/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/wu23d6s.png[/img]
[size=8pt]Login tips :|[/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/GbHarH2.png[/img]
[size=8pt]Control panel[/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/pZSJRZ4.png[/img]
Thanks to galkon for the client I'm using and to [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=43517]Zymus[/url] and [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=341531]sk8rdude461[/url] for helping me with a few issues.

item.title: Magor [Death]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

am i the only one who doesnt see the point in these topics for frameworks.

like cool, i get your practicing/learning the protocol/becoming a more efficient programmer but in all reality whats the purpose of alerting others/releasing it for the community?

its fairly certain that nobody would actually put time into a framework to develop a base unless they are absolutely certain of the frameworks advantage/scalability from itself versus writing one themselves or using something else.

if your idea is to better the community or whatnot why not try to achieve a plugin type system, develop tools, or work out the most efficient design to minimize usage load and maximize stability (idk how tf ryan did it tbh)

anyway congrats on the barebones. hope to see you contribute to it and further develop the base.

also a quick question, are you a fan of minimalistic “consoles” or is that the only amount of functionality/administration you can bother to add?

Read full topic

this made me lol

God fudgeing damned what’s up with you people trying to force git on me.
Why don’t you go preaching on the other 100 projects that don’t use it

stop trying to hide your shit code? ;D

It’s released
[/quote]
You shouldn’t feed the idiots on this website. They were trying to get you to release it, shit or not. That also goes for irl ;)[/quote]
Releasing was the plan, but after I added combat and fixed the bugs. Then it was finished.

item.title: Magor [Death]
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

I’m not sure if you’re just trolling at this point, but
here’s a decent presentation on what source control is and why use it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Di_-HAC6ms8
and here’s a nice talk on why git is probably better than any other version control system by it’s creator himself: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4XpnKHJAok8
GitHub is just one platform among others to easily share your git repositories online with other people, there are other git hosts such as
https://bitbucket.org/
https://gitorious.org/
https://about.gitlab.com/gitlab-com/
more at https://git.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/GitHosting

Read full topic

item.title: Magor [Death]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:23, topic:549194”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=668099.msg4470222#msg4470222 date=1422570108]

So, have you thought about how much easier it would have been for Zymus to help you had the project been on git?

No, why?
[/quote]
He could have just cloned your repo, made his changes and then committed it.[/quote]

[quote=“stCky, post:21, topic:549194”]Or ya know, you could have just looked at his commit and seen the lines he changed, instead of 48 hours of “what does function xxx give you” drawn out so slowly.

You probably could have accomplished a lot more things (y)[/quote]
I remember a time long ago where we would tell the people helping others in the help section, to not spoonfed
but help them on the way to the issue so they could learn something.
Apparently now you need to ask them to git their project so you can fix it for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Magor [Death]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Back on track after spending a few days on solving a chat update issue.
Thanks to zymus for spending so much time on trying to help me.

For some reason my clipping went broke so I got to fix that, also still have to add a
basic combat system. Will be basic since I don’t like combat. After that I’m pretty much finished
with this as a “base”.

item.title: Magor [Death]
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

J/S if I was hiring, your attitude towards new technologies and ideas (not just git, looks like you have a problem with anything modern), would be enough to put me off you. We’re part of a rapidly expanding industry, if you choose to stick to your own prehistoric methods you’ll be overtaken by the diploma grad fresh outta highschool.

What I’m trying to say is, people will think you’re lazy.

Read full topic

item.title: Magor [Death]
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:11, topic:549194”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=668099.msg4468919#msg4468919 date=1421836787]

So when will you put this on Github so we can leech your voidz?

Because github seems to be the hype lately, everything has to go on github. I don’t like hypes.
“but i can’t seez your code” As the project isn’t finished yet,
there’s not much point in that yet, I’d just get criticism on code that I probably still wanted to change/rewrite.

Why do you load every map region upon startup? It seems really unnecessary, especially since you probably won’t be using more than a quarter of them. I could be wrong but it just seems like a waste of resources.

Yeah I already thought about changing that, it’s not my primary concern but I plan on working on it
[/quote]
hype = I don’t like criticism on code[/quote]
I know RandQm as a person who hates to follow the mainstream.

Read full topic

item.title: Magor [Death]
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

can’t very well take the project seriously when the developer considers revision control a trend. You do realize if you make a code breaking mistake you would have to manually find where it is without it? it’s in your benefit to use one even if you don’t have a remote host (github) you clown.

Read full topic
